content:
Thank you for breaking down your spending. It's great that you're aware of where your money is going and willing to make changes.

It's clear that you overspent by $40, but it's also good that you took advantage of sales on non-perishable items. Those can be great deals, and stocking up can help you save in the long run.

To help you stay within your budget, here are some suggestions:

1. **Stick to your list**: Try to be more disciplined when it comes to impulse buys. Remember, just because something is on sale doesn't mean you need it right now. If it's not on your list, try to resist the temptation.
2. **Plan your meals**: Take some time to plan out your meals for the week. This will help you avoid buying unnecessary items and reduce food waste. You can also try meal prepping or cooking in bulk to save time and money.
3. **Set a "treat" budget**: Allocate a small amount, say $10-20, for impulse buys or treats. This way, you can still indulge in something you want, but within a controlled budget.
4. **Shop your pantry first**: Before going to the store, take stock of what you already have at home. This can help you avoid duplicate purchases and reduce waste.
5. **Use cash**: Consider using cash for your grocery shopping. This can help you stick to your budget and make you more mindful of your spending.
6. **Review and adjust**: Take a closer look at your spending habits and adjust your budget accordingly. If you find that you consistently overspend on certain items, try to cut back or find cheaper alternatives.
7. **Consider a price book**: Keep track of prices for your regular items and look for the best deals. This can help you make informed purchasing decisions and avoid overspending.

For your next trip, try to stick to your list and avoid impulse buys. You can also consider breaking your shopping trip into two parts: essentials and non-essentials. Buy the essentials first, and then see if you have room in your budget for non-essential items.

Remember, it takes time and practice to develop new habits, so be patient and don't be too hard on yourself if you slip up. You're taking steps in the right direction, and that's something to be proud of!
